name: Adam River(III+ with one optional V-)Short quality intermediate granite canyon
Alsek River(III-IV (V through Turnback Canyon))One of the most spectacular northern wilderness trips in the world.  Challenging logistics, epic glaciers.
Ashlu Creek - Bottom Mile(V)The last hurrah of the Ashlu.  Steep boulder piles that equate to difficult but good kayaking.
Ashlu Creek - Box Canyon(V)The signature run of southwest BC - clean bedrock in a deep box canyon.
Ashlu Creek - Mine Run(IV-V at medium levels.)An under-rated classic - bedrock rapids, many big holes.
Ashlu Creek - Play Run(III+ (IV-))Boulder Garden fun which is now sadly tricky to access!
Ashlu Mini Mine(IV)A short intro to Ashlu paddling, bedrock rapids, boulder gardens and optional waterfall.
Ashnola River(IV)Continuous river running in the hot and sunny Okanagan area of south central BC.
Babine River(III+-IV)A classic, class 3/4 wilderness multiday.  Big water on the Skeena.
Beaver River (Kinbasket Canyon)(IV/IV+)Early season warm up run with a linear class I to IV+ progression.
Bedwell River(IV+ (P))A hike in multiday through the heart of Vancouver Island
Benson River - Lower(V)A sketchy caving trip in your kayak
Benson River - Upper(IV+ at low water)A short low volume canyon in the middle of nowhere
Big Creek - Lower(V with a big portage)Scrappy, dangerous whitewater through a remote canyon
Big Mouth Creek(III-IV)A beautiful wilderness adventure, cruising down continuous rapids, surrounded by many unique rock features and old growth forests.
Big Silver Creek - Middle(V)Very committing granite gorge with big rapids, marginal waterfalls and hard portages.
Big Silver Creek - Upper(IV-IV+ at medium levels)Boulder rapids in deep gorges, one clean waterfall.  Fantastic scenery.
Birkenhead River - Lower(III(+), IV if doing the first rapids)A fun play run with an optional bigger rapid at the start.
Birkenhead River - Upper(IV-V at medium, V at medium-high and up.)Endless, top notch boulder drops that only get better as the run progresses.
Blaeberry River - Split Creek to Thompson Falls(III+ to IV )A seldom run, but decent quality intermediate run.
Blaeberry River - Thompson Falls Section(IV+ to V)2 short canyons. The first is a gorgeous class 2 slot canyon, the second is a short but intense class 5 canyon followed by a bit of class 3 run out.
Blanket Creek (Sutherland Falls)(V)A classic BC park and huck; one of the friendliest and most accessible large waterfalls out there
Bobbie Burns Creek into Spillimacheen River(III+ to IV (V))Lovely class 4 river running. Starts out as boulder gardens, slowly changing into bedrock rapids as the run progresses.
Boston Bar Creek(IV)A park and huck next to the Coquihalla Highway
Bowser River(II-III with one long IV+ rapid)Paddle up close to several glaciers on this chain of lakes.
Bridge River(III+-IV)Pool drop with big boulders + flat long scenic canyons
Bridge River - Terzaghi Dam to Yalakom(III-IV (IV+ at big releases))Low Water Boulder garden run which occasionally has releases.
Brittania Creek(IV-V)A roadside double drop park and huck attraction with easy access and a sketchy take out.
Bulkley Canyon(III+ to IV-)The Smithers classic run. Big water canyons with 'boogie water' and plenty of catch on the fly waves in between
Callaghan Creek(IV-V at medium levels.)Whistler's ultra classic.  Clean waterfalls, bedrock and boulder gardens.
Cameron River(IV at medium levels)Excellent river-running with small canyons and bedrock rapids.
Capilano River(III)A short run in North Vancouver flowing through a scenic canyon with easy whitewater.
Cariboo River - Lower Run(II to III (III+ at high water))Big waves, some holes and boulders, a canyon, and flat water at the end. Large Volume
Cariboo River - Upper Run(III+ to IV- (IV in high water))Big waves, big holes, continuous, mellower towards the end, Large Volume.
Cascade Creek(IV-V (V+))Steep, manky boulder rapids, a good bedrock canyon and some enormous waterfalls at the take out.
Cayoosh Creek(IV+ at medium levels.)Nice river running through a deep, arid canyon.  Classic scenery and good whitewater.
Cheakamus – Paradise Valley(II (III))Fun beginner run
Cheakamus River - Balls To The Wall(IV-IV+)Extension of the Upper Cheak - great class IV-IV+ river running, and a bonus waterfall.  Some wood.
Cheakamus River - Cal-Cheak (Callaghan into Cheakamus)(III)A great short run for intermediate paddlers with some fun surf waves at higher flows
Cheakamus River - Cheakamus Lake Down(Continuous III+)Paddle out of a beautiful mountain lake into a continuous braided river full of wood.
Cheakamus River - Daisy Lake Canyon(V at medium levels.)The hardest regularly run section of the Cheak - excellent boating in a good canyon with a few gnarly spots.
Cheakamus River - Dam Run(III)A fun, roadside class III with a short portage around a class V rapid. Runnable year round.
Cheakamus River - Upper(IV at 2.5, continuous.  Gets harder as levels rise.)Classic. Continuous river running at its finest.
Chehalis River - Lower (aka Statlu-Chehalis)(III-IV-)The best intermediate run in the Fraser Valley, down a wilderness canyon
Chehalis River - Upper(IV with optional V)A full day adventure through a series of canyons
Chemainus River - Copper Canyon(III-IV+ at medium levels.)Good moderate difficulty whitewater with some beautiful canyons.
Chilcotin River  (Chilko-Chilcotin-Fraser)(II-IV)Classic multiday raft trip across the Chilcotin Plateau
Chilko - Bidwell to Taseko(IV-)Remote, beautiful clear water, big volume.
Chilliwack Canyon - Camp Foley to Slesse(III-IV low, IV- medium, IV high)Pool-drop at low and medium, continuous at higher levels, bedrock and boulder gardens, medium volume river
Chilliwack River - Pointa Vista to Vedder Bridge(II)Braided gravel bed, pool drop, medium volume
Chilliwack River – Post Creek to Camp Foley(III+)Continuous boulder gardens, medium volum, rarely paddled, watch for wood.
Chilliwack River - Slesse to Tamihi(III, one IV- @ Tamihi)Gravel bars, pool drop, some floating
Chilliwack River - Tamihi to Pointa Vista(III, one IV- @ Tamihi)Some continuous boulder gardens especially at higher levels, pool drop, gravel bed, medium volume.
Clearwater River - Gatling Gorge(V)Big water canyon with a lot of flat paddling!
Clearwater River - Play Run(III+ (IV))The Ottawa of BC? Big volume, warm, playboating with big rapids.
Clearwater River - Upper(IV)Sabretooth Rapid to The Kettle
Clearwater River - Upper Upper(IV- with optional V)Big Volume Wave train and Big Waterfalls on the same river!?
Clendinning Creek(IV-V)Quality 2 day boulder run with very continuous whitewater and stunning scenery.
Clore River - Grand Canyon(IV-V)A classic fly in multiday.  Steep, continuous rapids in a deep canyon with cheap and easy logistics.
Coal River - Lower(I-III (IV))A floaty wilderness multiday with an nice whitewater canyon at the end.
Coquihalla River(III+)Continuous boulder gardens, pool-drop, gravel bed, short bedrock canyon, some floating sections, medium volume.
Coquitlam(III (IV-))'Novelty' run. A few boulder gardens, gravel bars and flat water. Rarely paddled because its usually too low. Watch for wood.
Cowichan River - Skutz Falls to Marie Canyon(III (IV))Consistently flowing class III canyon.
Cummins River(II-III (with portages))Remote, multi-day packraft trip through wild old growth rainforest
Dipper Creek(V+)Big waterfalls, mandatory class V, huge commitment.  Top tier adventure boating in a fantastic canyon.
Douglas Creek(IV-V)A short exciting run, with more to explore upstream.  A series of scenic waterfalls above from the small hydro dam infrastructure.
Downie Canyon(IV with a portage)A short committing canyon with some fun technical rapids and beautiful scenery
Duti River(IV+, depending on the level)The Duti offers challenging whitewater in a spectacular remote wilderness setting.
Eagle River(I-III with one portage)Remote wilderness expedition with easy whitewater
East Boulder Creek(IV+ to V, level dependent.)A fantastic steep creek.
Elaho River - Fear Canyon(IV-V depending on level)A big river with many faces.  Best known as a class IV-V big water run.
Elaho River - Upper(IV-V)A late season canyon run with fun whitewater at the end of the road in the Elaho Valley.
Elaho-Squamish(III (IV-))Cold water and big waves
Elk River - Middle(IV)Great moderate whitewater in a classic Rockies canyon.
Elk River - Upper(V)A short, stout run with challenging rapids and a clean 35 foot waterfall.
Foley Creek(III(+) with potential IV moves with wood.)An alternative start to the Chilliwack Canyon

Fraser River – Alexandra Bridge to Yale(II-III, one IV-)Huge volume, pool drop, big crashing waves and swirly eddies, lots of floating. The road is high above the river and accessible only in a few spots.
Furry Creek(V-V+)Short and stout park-n-huck waterfalls.
Gamsby River(III-V)Ultra-classic, coastal wilderness multiday.  3 days of white water.  2 days of flat.
Gilttoyees Creek(IV-V)Coastal wilderness adventure with breathtaking scenery.  The whitewater is good but not classic.
Goldstream Falls(V)Four sweet park and huck water
Gordon River - Flood Run(III-IV (V).)A high water alternative to paddle when everything on the southern Island is flooding.
Gordon River - Middle Gordon(IV-V)Good pool-drop whitewater with big ledges and clean rapids.
Gordon River - Upper Gordon(IV at medium water.)Bedrock pool-drop.  Fun, clean rapids and clear water.
Grand Canyon of the Stikine(V)The most famous class 5 multiday in North America. Big volume paddling in a spectacular, committing canyon.
Granite Creek(V)Waterfalls.  A great waterfall run with some boulder rapids and a lot of wood.
Granite Creek (Tulameen)(IV+ (P))A decent low volume canyon run, but not recommended due to very dangerous mining adits
Green River - Middle(IV-V)Surprisingly good whitewater on a Whistler run that sees little traffic.  Often tragically infested with wood.
Gun Creek(III-IV.  Slightly stressful because of wood, and a lack of good eddies.)A 12 km long rapid.  Very continuous and splashy whitewater in a beautiful part of BC.
Harris Creek - Canyon(IV-V)A short run in a small canyon on the southern end of Vancouver Island.  Nice class IV-V boating.
Heber River - Lower(IV-V (P))A box canyon ending at a baseball diamond
Hirsch Creek(V)Great whitewater with a deep and committing canyon.  Beautiful scenery.
Homathko River(V (V+))Big water wilderness multiday trip - world class.
Hurley River - Canyon(V)An impressive canyon with good class V whitewater.  A different feel from the typical Coast Mountain rivers.
Iskut River(IV-V)A fantastic northern BC multiday with a long hike out.
Iskut River - Kinaskan Lake down(II)An easy roadside float
Jordan River(IV+)The crown jewel of Revelstoke. « BC Class 4 » at it’s best.
Khtada River(V)A classic North Coast hike in mission. Large bedrock slides and rapids in the rainforest.
Kicking Horse - Palliser to Kicking Horse Rest Area(III+/IV )12 km of high quality river running
Kicking Horse River - Kicking Horse Rest Area to Lower Canyon(V)Continuous, steep river running.
Kicking Horse River - Lower Canyon to Downtown Golden(IV)Classic, continuous river running. Fast, surging waves, powerful holes, satisfying eddies to play with.
Kicking Horse - Yoho Park Boundary to Palliser(II+)Scenic river running with significant wood hazard
Kitsumkalum (Kalum) River(III+ to IV.  Pushy at high water - a swim would be unpleasant.)Big water play run.  At high water, one of the best play runs in BC.

Klastline(V)A northern BC adventure. Remote and with only a handful of descents the Klastline is a good option for anyone who plans to be in the area and wants to run something other than the Stikine. Some class 4 bedrock rapids, 2 big waterfalls (one that has yet to be run) and some steep boulder gardens make for varied if not "ultra-classic" whitewater.
Kleanza Creek(IV-V)A fantastic North Coast creek run.  High caliber whitewater with a deep and beautiful bedrock canyon.  Wood is a common problem.
Kokish River(V at medium levels.)One of the greatest class V runs on the Island.  A lengthy river full of complex boulder rapids in a lush canyon. Unfortunately it is dewatered for an IPP.
Koksilah River - Canyon(III-IV)A good introductory creeking run near Victoria
Lens Creek(IV-V at low to medium flows)A local favorite on southern Vancouver Island.  An adventurous day of rapids, shuttling and portaging.
Lillooet River - Between the Lakes(Class II/III+ (IV))Stunning scenery multi-day option not far from Vancouver.
Link River(III below the slides)The shortest river on Vancouver Island
Little Qualicum Falls(V)An exciting double drop draped in mystical Vancouver Island rainforest.
Lower Mamquam(II+)Good beginner run with small rock garden

Lower Pingston(V)Hard charging BC creeking at its gnarliest. Hectic continuous class 5 with even scarier portages. Often full of wood. An absolute treat on its own or as the finisher to a long day of Pingston paddling.
Lynn Creek(III at low levels, IV when the water is high.)A popular urban run with a picturesque canyon and fun rapids.  Optional waterfall at the start.
Mahatta River(IV with one harder rapid )A fun west coast canyon hidden at the end of the island.
Mamquam River - Mamquam Falls(V)One of the world's most sought after big waterfalls, and one of the whitewater crown jewels of the Sea to Sky.
Mamquam River - Upper(III-IV)A fun and scenic class III+ stretch on the Upper Mamquam. The last two kilometres known as the Middle Mamquam is class IV, but please see the dam warning.
Marble River(II-III with optional V)A scenic full day paddle with optional class V drops
McDame Creek(II-III)An easy roadside creek
McGregor Canyon(IV+-V)A really nice 5km (ish) canyon located northeast of Prince George. Great character to the whitewater.
Meager Creek - Lower(IV(+), very continuous)A glacial read and run blitz underneath one of Canada's most unstable volcanoes.
Middle Memekay River(III+ with one IV)Nice long intermediate canyon run from a small creek down into a river.
Moyeha River(Scenic I-III packrafting, or manky IV-V creeking)A difficult traverse of a pristine watershed
Muelville Creek falls(V)Two park and hucks in a beautiful canyon
Nahatlach River – Francis Lake to Apocynum Campground(III+(IV))Medium volume, continuous boulder gardens, big holes, lots of fun.
Nahatlatch River - Canyon(IV at medium levels.)A short but fun medium volume run on the dry side of the Coast Mountains.
Nass River(III-V)Everything from a 5-6 day wilderness trip to a big water play run.
Norrish Creek(IV-IV+ at medium levels.  Mainly class III-IV but one unportagable rapid is tricky and dangerous.)Clean-ish boulders and bedrock with some very tight and deep canyons.
North Stein River(V+)Remote, multiday, hike in, hard core creeking.  Includes a pleasant paddle out on the main Stein.
Pamela Creek(IV-V)One of the better creeks in Gold River - excellent bedrock ledges and waterfalls, with some classic Island mank.
Perry River(III-IV)« Old Faithful » for the revelstoke paddler. One of the first runs to thaw and the last ones to dry up.

Pingston - Middle(IV with a short V section at the end)Excellent quality class 4 with a few bigger rapids near the end. Continuous without being pushy, clean read and run for the first 3/4 with reasonably easy scouting and portaging options for the bigger rapids
Pitt River - Upper(IV+ with a portage )Remote, multi-day wilderness run with tricky logistics and challenging paddling.
Prospect Creek(IV)A creeky alternate entrance to Spius Creek; scenic but manky
Puntledge River - Upper(V)A unique section consisting entirely of massive slides. Unpredictable dam releases.
Quesnel River(III+ to IV- (IV at High water))Big Volume, with play waves at the top. Home of the Unlikely Fest.
Rogers Creek(IV-V)Short run in an amazing gorge - includes the famous triple falls.
Rutherford Creek(Continuous class IV-V, class V at higher levels.)Continuous boulder rapids studded with some classic bedrock drops.
Ryan River - Lower(Continuous class IV-V. Class V at high flows.)Continuous boofalicious boulder gardens.
Ryan River - Upper(V)Very steep boulder run - a hike-in day trip.  Hard kayaking.
Seton River(II+)A quick cool down in Lillooet.
Seymour River Canyon(Highly level dependent - ranges from fun class IV to raging class V.)Classic kayaking in a deep box canyon.  You would never know it's in the heart of North Van.
Seymour River - Lower run(II (III- at high levels))Easy boulder gardens and gravel bars. Many boulder gardens, gravel bed, low volume; can be a challenge for beginners.
Seymour River – Upper Run(III-)Pool-drop, some flat sections, gravel bed, low volume
Silverhope Creek(IV-IV+ to V, depending on the put in and take out used.)A good quality boulder run with tons of fun boogie.
Similkameen Canyon(III+/IV-/IV)Beautiful Deep Canyon running through some unique scenery
Similkameen River - Bromley to Stemwinder(II (III))Great novice run with warmer water than the coast
Skagit River - Wilderness Section(II-III)A wilderness float through old growth forest
Skookumchuck(III, massive volume.)Classic tidal rapid surfing.  Character changes with the speed of the current.  Awesome surroundings.
Skookumchuck Creek(III+-IV )16 km of high quality whitewater. River running at medium-high water with more of a creeky feel at medium-low water.
Skookum Creek(V)Big, clean waterfalls and tight canyons.
Slesse Creek(III with a short IV- canyon)Low volume, gravel bed, many boulder gardens with a short narrow canyon section (“Keyhole Canyon”).
Small River(III-IV (optional V at put in))A Small River packed with big fun! Continuous class 3, be on the lookout for wood
Snowcap Creek(III-V)An obscure run near Rogers Creek with good whitewater and a short, hard to scout canyon in the middle.
Soo River(IV at medium levels, somewhat continuous.  Tolerates high water very well, but becomes class V.)Fun river running in a small valley.
Soo River - Railroad Canyon(V)A short, stout addition to the classic section of the Soo.  Easy access canyon with big holes.
Spillimacheen(V)Short and sweet, Spilli has 5 major rapids with quality boogie water in between.
Squamish River - Upper(III-IV boating through some significant canyons.)Amazing canyons - unless you're brave, it's an early or late season scenery trip.
Statlu Creek - Statlu Canyon(V at medium levels.)Short but high quality, creamy smooth granite bedrock and boulders deep in the Fraser Valley.
Stave River(V (V+ to VI))Stout southwest BC multi-day kayaking.  There's unrealized opportunity to go big in there.
Stawamus River(III (V))A short novelty run in Squamish that's fun when everything in the area is running high.
Stein River - Multiday Trip(IV-IV+, V at high water)A nice multiday trip on the arid side of the Coast Mountains.  Expect a lot of portages caused by wood.
Stikine - Tahltan to Telegraph(II-III)A mellow way to experience the runout of the Grand Canyon Stikine
St. Leon Creek(V)A steep, small creek with hectic boogie interspersed with some big, clean bedrock drops.
Tamihi Creek (Lower)(IV+ with a mandatory portage)Manky boulder garden turning into steep committing canyon with fun class IV drops towards the end.
Tamihi Creek - Upper(IV+ / V)Steep boulder gardens, continuous, low volume
Tatlow Creek(V)One of the best class V runs in SW BC.  Waterfalls, slides, electric blue water and difficult access.
Thompson River(III, big water.)Big water boating in a warm climate with some play opportunities.  Interesting scenery.
Thompson River – Goldpan to Frog(III-)Lots of flat water with some powerful eddylines, whirlpools and a few waves, huge volume river.
Tingle Creek(II-III)Beautiful clear turquoise waters, south of the Stave Valley.  The secluded Tingle Valley runs between Mount Robbie Reid, and the Justice Group (Judge Howay & The Defendant).

Toby Creek - 7 Canyons(Mostly class IV/IV+ with one definite class V that can be portaged)Beautiful class IV+ creeking that just keeps going and going! Easy access, minimal portaging, clean rapids and just enough spice to keep you focused.
Trent River(V for the waterfall; III for the paddle out)Park and huck waterfall and a mellow paddle out to the ocean
Trout Creek(IV+)A microcreeking epic in wine country, tragically clogged with wood
Troutline Creek(I-II; V+ Canyon Below)A novelty subalpine float, with stouts downstream left to explore
Tsable River - Prickly Canyon(V)Steep, continuous and committing with various slides and drops.
Tulameen River(II-III (IV for "Tulameanie Drop")A chill run with an out of character class IV drop.
Tutshi River(III-IV at low water, IV-V at high water)Fantastic big volume creeking.  The best and most accessible whitewater out of Whitehorse, Yukon.
Ucona River - Upper(IV with optional V)Technical waterfalls through coastal rainforest
Upana River(IV+ to V)A short creek run in Gold River with a blind 20 footer
Upper Callaghan(III+ with one IV- easy waterfall)Scenic wilderness-feel but not far from a road. Lots to surf!

Upper Pingston(V)One of B.C.'s best steep creeks. Classic whitewater; continuous, clean, few portages and a handful of bigger rapids. Not much is "must run", but be prepared to run a good amount of class 5 if you put on as either too much portaging or hiking out would be a lot of work and probably end in the dark. If the upper is too high the middle is a good back up option.
Upper Soo(III (with a major portage, and quite a bit of flat water))Majestic tributary valley to the Whistler region.
Upper Tulameen(III-V)Remote, wilderness feel; low-volume canyons
White River - Canyon(IV-V)Classic lappable north Island canyon
White River - Lower(III)A good intermediate canyon right off the north Island highway
White River (Nass tributary)(IV)A high volume tributary to the Nass
White River - Upper(III-IV (P))Moderate whitewater but with a difficult portage. The fly in the ointment of the White River drainage
Williams Creek(IV-V)The local home run, with high quality smooth granite boulders and bedrock.
Wilson/Fitzstubbs Creek(III-V)A beautiful class fun paddling destination for all skill levels.
Yoho(V)Classic whitewater in an intimidating canyon.
